Body:
I have successfully built an IoT platform with mongoDB and chart.js.

I have paired between the sensor reading value and the timestamp as a label.

Javascript Code:

for (var property in data) {	        if (data.hasOwnProperty(property)) {	            var varTag = property;	            var varData = data[property];	            var label = varData.name;	            var xLabels = [];	            var yValues = [];		            for (var i in varData.values) {	                // extract values	                yValues.push(varData.values[i][0]);	                // extract timestamp in a Date object and format the output in a string	                var t = new Date(varData.values[i][1]);	                // add formated timestamp to the array holding values for x axis	                //timeValues=moment(t).format(DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm");	                timeLabels=moment(t).clone().format("HH:mm:ss");	                //xValues.push(timeValues)	                xLabels.push(timeLabels)	            }	        }	        var ctx = document.getElementById(varTag+"_canvas").getContext("2d");		        var myChart=new Chart(ctx
column22:
fill:false } ] }

But what I want is a timestamp not as a label but as a value.

The problem is my value and timestamp are separate arrays
column29:
..]

while the format on chart.js is as follows:

data: {	labels: label

My question is how to transform my arrays into chart.js format (object-like)?
